class_notes:
Mondays, 6:00-8:00 pm - GBS 301
Class Dates: 9/11, 9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10/16, alternate date: 10/23 (the alternate date is only used if the instructor or the school has an emergency that causes one of the scheduled dates to be canceled-it will not be held as a makeup date for a missed class).


Seminar Description:  Learning how to apply personal finance concepts to real world scenarios. The seminar will focus on how to analyze clients' financial pictures and goals to implement a financial plan. Each student will build a financial plan for their personal situation and have their plan evaluated by a financial planner.


Instructor: John McColl graduated with a finance and accounting concentration from Goizueta in 2010. After graduation, he worked for 5 years as a financial statement auditor with EY where he helped multiple companies pursue IPOs. For the past 7 years, he has worked as a financial advisor with Edward Jones where he assists people with their retirement planning and investment goals.
course_description: Senior seminar courses fall outside the scope of traditional academic coursework, and instead allow students to learn from and interact with experienced practitioners, and to develop industry-specific insights, fine-tune career skills, and increase professional exposure.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the BBA program.
